attributes.action: Tell us how & when you will have us living within our means to avoid bankruptcy.
attributes.background: We are facing bankruptcy because Gov overspent Tax Revenue £534 ml every single day during 2005-15 (£624 ml 15-16) but we are allowing thousands of immigrants into our Country each week all of whom want at our expense somewhere to live, healthcare, education for their children and money to live on.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of Healthcare, Education and Welfare equates to £99 per week for every living person so a family of 4 immigrants (including a home) costs us in the region of £600 per week for a man to do a job that others will not do whilst at the same time we pay capable men large sums of money to stay at home and do nothing. Is it surprising we are facing bankruptcy? Please see my website www.mrms.uk for many more alarming facts about the way Government is running our Country.

attributes.action: All Parkinson's Disease patients entitlement to a Medical Exemption Certificate
attributes.background:
People with life-long conditions such as e.g. Epilepsy, Diabetes, are entitled to a Medical Exemption Certificate. 
A Medical Exemption Certificate entitles people to free NHS Prescriptions, Dental care etc. 
I believe Parkinson's Disease should be acknowledged as one of these conditions.

attributes.action: Make Byways Safer
attributes.background: Byways are being used increasingly by motor bikers, as off road circuits, which is putting other users such as walkers and horse riders at risk. Riders in particular, are vulnerable, and a serious accident seems inevitable. We need biker restrictions urgently enforced, before someone is killed.

attributes.action: Change car insurance law to insure driver rather than vehicle for road risks
attributes.background: Car insurance has been incomprehensibly expensive for years, only getting more expensive when you use your policy and make a claim. The biggest rip off from a consumer's point of view is for people who, for whatever reason, run more than one vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
It is only physically possible to drive one vehicle at once so why are we paying a double premium? The largest portion of a vehicle insurance policy is Road risks so my proposition is a driver specific insurance for road risks and an optional, much smaller vehicle premium for fire and theft.

Multi car insurance policies do exist but their premiums don't represent the true risk to the insurance company, usually offering a maximum of a 25% discount in a very small number of cases.

attributes.action: Demand a public enquiry into the MOD handling of military abuse claims in Iraq.
attributes.background: We want a public enquiry into the MOD's handling of historic abuse allegations brought against British Military personnel.

attributes.action: Enable U.K. roaming
attributes.background: Not all mobile telephone networks cover all areas of the UK. Roaming would allow all subscribers to use all networks
attributes.additional_details: The National Infrastructure Report last year high-lighted significant deficiencies in existing networks' coverage

attributes.action: Ban the use of quad bikes dirt bikes on all public roads.
attributes.background: Dirt bikes & quad bikes are becoming a real nuisance on public roads & public parks all over the U.K. The police are unable to do anything. This needs to be stopped now before someone gets seriously hurt.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC Television Licence.
attributes.background: The BBC licence fee is a unlawful tax against watching television. The BBC should not dictate our ability to watch television such as ITV and Channel 4.

attributes.action: Basic First aid should be taught on the school curriculum.
attributes.background: People in the UK are unwilling or nervous to perform first aid and cpr when needed! If children were taught it at school, not only would this help those people injured in accidents or taken ill, it would also ease pressure on the already overstretched NHS.

attributes.action: Stop county councils from increasing council tax by more than annual inflation.
attributes.background: Surrey County Council have recently stated that they are proposing a 15% increase in council tax, when the current annual inflation rate at December 2016 is only around 2%. It is not fair or affordable for the public to pay so much more than the rate of inflation due to the council's inefficiencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Articles in local Surrey Mirror press:

19/1/2017: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/surrey-county-council-announces-plans-for-15-per-cent-council-tax-hike/story-30070982-detail/story.html

23/12/2016: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/cash-strapped-surrey-county-council-refuses-to-rule-out-eye-watering-200-rise-in-council-tax/story-30006252-detail/story.html?f8g6fa

attributes.action: Involve the British public in the fight against climate change
attributes.background: Our collective CO2 emissions are just those of each individual added together: each of us can and must limit our carbon footprint. As well as strong legislative action, the government should contact every home to explain the reality and danger of climate change and advise what each of us should do.
attributes.additional_details:
The WHO: "Climate change is among the greatest health risks of the 21st century." Personal actions should be prioritised by relative impact. Former DECC Chief Scientific Advisor Sir David MacKay urged these steps, among others:
Stop (or dramatically reduce) flying
Replace driving with public transport, cycling or walking
Reduce the energy needed to make products we buy (frequent new electronics & clothing, packaging)
Eat vegetarian 6/7 days
Turn heating to 15-17 degrees
Increase home insulation.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum sentence for those found guilty of cruelty to a child
attributes.background: Innocence.The innocence of a baby or child should be cherished. But not all think that way. Some people see that innocence as their's to take. They neglect, ill-treat and assault. We've all read the stories, cried and screamed in disbelief at the sentences. It is time to do something about it.
attributes.additional_details: Cruelty to a child under the Children and Young Persons Act 1933 s.1 carries a maximum sentence of 10 years imprisonment. It includes a range of offences; neglect, abandonment, assault and cruelty, whether carried out once or numerous times. Children who this Act is meant to protect will never get their stolen innocence back and they get no justice with a maximum sentence of 10 years for those who stole it. The maximum sentence for those found guilty of child cruelty needs to be increased.

attributes.action: stop the sale of The Royal Citadel Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: The government is going ahead with the sale of The royal Citadel in the next 10 years. It has been the home for thousands of commandos, who look at it as the home and a place to remember the fall comrades. Once again we feel that we are being let down by our MPS WHO WILL NEVER UNDERSTAND LOYALTY.

attributes.action: Ignore the petition 'defining marriage as exclusively between 1 man & 1 woman'
attributes.background:
The UK is a leading country in the world for equal rights. Any petition sought to undermine this is detrimental to our society and any current influence we have in the world. 

Regardless of who you are, and who you love, everyone has the right to express that love and wed.

attributes.action: Make Health Tourists pay for their treatment
attributes.background: We believe that people who are not from the UK and use the NHS for treatment should be made to pay. Health Tourism costs the NHS between £200m and £2bn. It is time the Government acted and stopped the chronic abuse of health tourists using the NHS for free and made them pay their way.

attributes.action: A Law to give temp shelter to all rough sleepers if temps are predicted at Zero.
attributes.background:
Put a Law in place, that forces local authorities to give shelter to all rough sleepers should temperatures be predicted at below zero. 
Just today, this guy died on our streets, make it stop
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tragedy-unknown-homeless-man-found-9372526?ICID=FB_mirror_main
attributes.additional_details:
Every year these guys face all weather conditions, and it is not acceptable by any means, there should be a law placed that these guys know that should the weather drop to zero they will be allocated some shelter, should they want it. 
Each local authority should be forced to allocate shelter by the Government, and I ask that a law be put in place to protect those in this difficult situation.

attributes.action: List the common hedgehog (Erinaceus europaeus) as an endangered species.
attributes.background: The Government do not believe it is appropriate to list hedgehogs as a protected species, which is best reserved for species deliberately killed or injured by humans. I had a hedgehog in my garden last summer - first in years.  Then found it in the back alley, stamped to death. They need protecting.
attributes.additional_details:
One dead hedgehog killed deliberately by humans is one dead hedgehog too many. Results of the BBC Gardeners’ World Magazine's annual wildlife survey show that 51% of people did not see a hedgehog at all in 2016, up from 48% in 2015. Just 12% saw a hedgehog regularly.  This poll’s result is in line other recent polls by the People’s Trust for Endangered Species and the RSPB.

http://www.discoverwildlife.com/news/survey-results-reveal-sharp-decline-hedgehog-sightings

attributes.action: Allow 16/17 year olds to vote.
attributes.background: In Year 9 in secondary school we are made to choose our GCSE subjects, at 16 we can smoke, win the lottery have sex, get a job. At 17 you can drive and you start choosing your University/life root and yet we cannot vote until we're 18. WE as a generation are one of the most educated ever. FIX IT.

attributes.action: Increase income tax by 1% and use it to boost NHS funding only.
attributes.background: We are aware that the NHS is facing difficult times.We are fortunate that is has fantastic infrastructure employing a wealth of skilled workers. The NHS directly benefits all of us. Even those with private health insurance employ staff relying on the NHS. We will all benefit from a strong NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
When we or our loved ones are sick, we need the support of the health service and we value the skill and commitment of staff. Nobody likes to wait for hours for appointments, test results or operations, but the service is under strain. The range of treatments is vast and the population is growing.
Every penny each of us puts into the NHS is a way of looking after ourselves and those we love.
Let's have an NHS to feel proud of. I am happy to have two less Starbucks a week to make this happen.

attributes.action: Give everyone the right to see a GP within 48 hours of making an appointment
attributes.background: Many patients in the UK are waiting up to a month to get a routine GP appointment. This puts patients at risk, places an intolerable burden on A&E departments and undermines efforts at preventative healthcare. The government should set a target that everyone can see a GP within 48 hours of asking.

attributes.action: Terrorism offence to carry a minimum 15 year jail term!
attributes.background: Any offence of terrorism or terrorist activities to carry a jail term of 15 years minimum

attributes.action: Reform the Lords by replacing life peers with fixed-term, local area senators.
attributes.background: The House of Lords needs urgent reform because, as demonstrated by its behaviour over the Article 50 Brexit Bill, it is not fit for purpose.
attributes.additional_details:
Rename it the Senate House. 

Repeal all legislation for the creation of new peers.

The leader, or elected mayor, of each unitary or district council in the UK to nominate one Councillor to serve as a Senator (MS) for either five years, the end of their term of elected council office or such time as they are expelled by a simple majority vote in the Senate. In each instance another Senator will be nominated by the leader, or elected mayor, of the relevant authority.

attributes.action: Fund sensory profiling/assessment for everyone who has an autism diagnosis
attributes.background: Sensory issues can have a profound effect on a person’s life. Many people with autism have problems processing everyday sensory information.
attributes.additional_details: A sensory profile can help us understand the person’s needs. Currently it is not readily available on the NHS, there needs to be extra funding available for this. There needs to be funding made available for at least a sensory assessment for everyone who has an autism diagnosis, if not a sensory profile, and if needed a sensory diet.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: We want a General Election before the Government initiates Article 50.
attributes.background:
We agree to the PM’s appeal that we should all ‘come together’ after all, we are supposed to be the UK and not a divisive little England, Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland.

We have been fed with lies, and propaganda by various parties and media. It is time to get our country’s act together!
attributes.additional_details: Whether it was the result of the PM and her government or not, it is obvious that the country is suffering from, NHS chaos; the fluctuating value of the £ Sterling; the increase in ‘borrowed’ public money; increasing racial ill-feeling against foreign EU workers & immigrants; increasing import costs (particularly food and fuel); strikes & increases of public transport and the public fears & confusion of our future. We need a genuine majority for an election & not a first past the post system.

attributes.action: British Parliament help ex-military to find accommodation after service
attributes.background: Quite a lot of the people who are homeless are ex-military who have found it impossible to find accommodation and cannot get on a housing list due to having no postal address.
attributes.additional_details: Too many of the homeless are ex-military and find there is insufficient help for them to find a home after finishing military service. Without a permanent address it is almost impossible  to gain employment .Often they end up sleeping on the streets and alcoholism is a real threat as their life descends into a feeling of hopelessness and despair. Will you sign this petition to ask our Government to ensure there is adequate help for them before they finish their military service .

attributes.action: Link a dog owners national Insurance number to microchip details.
attributes.background: I have owned dogs for over 25 years. I am passionate about rescues and the hard work they do to ensure a dogs welfare. I am livid! That animal abuse is not taken more seriously in this country. Animal abusers should be put on a list.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of animal abuse videos I see the amount of dogs in rescues who struggle to make ends meet could be lowered. Micro chipping is law now in this country for dogs. Why can we not pass a law that states that when you get a dog you have to attach your national insurance number to said dog?? If you sell this dog rehome or put no rescue or even dump and you do not change NI details any costs incurred should be billed to the last NI on record, this way any costs made could be received back.

attributes.action: Stop the Bank of England using Palm Oil in the new £20 notes
attributes.background: The Bank of England are considering using Palm Oil in their new £20 note... very plain and simple, this would add an additional boost to Palm Oil usage & production, which is extremely damaging to the environment. Please sign!
attributes.additional_details:
A couple of links to review - for learning purposes. 

1: https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil
2: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/palm-oil
3: http://wwf.panda.org/what_we_do/footprint/agriculture/palm_oil/

attributes.action: Provide a living wage to health care students.
attributes.background: Nursing and midwifery students enter the profession with compassion, but are being left short! Over 2300 hours of clinical placements are required by the NMC, which can often make students feel like free labour, and forced to take on additional paid work to cover the basics. Give them a living wage.
attributes.additional_details: Many health care students struggle.to eat and pay bills, and are working clinical placements shifts, on rotation and without payment. I believe that we should support our future nhs by encouraging more students to join the NHS. Making a better financial support mechanism in place will ensure this. Health care degrees are unlike other, they are often unable to get paid work because of the shift pattern of they're placement. I hope you will support us and provide a living wage while on placement.

attributes.action: Subsidise train fares for 16-18 year olds in full-time education
attributes.background: My 2 sons best mode of transport to School is the train.We just paid £191 for my 15 year old for this term(6wks) and my 16yr old £382 for the same journey just because he turned 16!!He is still in the same school.16 -18 year olds in full time education should not be paying adult fares
attributes.additional_details: I challenged GWR( the rail company in this instance but other tail companies are also guilty) and I was told that there is a 16 - 25 year old 1/3rd off discount card which sounded brilliant except you can't activate it before 10am or you pay £12 flat day rate which works out more expensive than an adult season ticket.The 1/3rd discount card is a fraud as it does not do what it says!!. What 16 - to 25 year old goes anywhere meaningful daily after 10am? Students and workers take earlier trains.

attributes.action: If Parliament fails to approve an Agreement to Leave, UK shall Remain in EU.
attributes.background: The UK is successful in the EU. Leaving has well known risks.The Government's position is that, if the government fails to get its agreement with the EU approved by Parliament, the UK should leave anyway.The UK should, in that case,  remain in the EU under the treaties, as leaving will have failed.

attributes.action: Make tools VAT exempt for PAYE employed tradesman
attributes.background: Many workers employed in different trades are required to purchase and maintain their own hand tools and tool storage. It is unfair and unreasonable that there should be VAT levied on such items as they are not purchased for want but out of necessity

attributes.action: Make thieves liable for their victims insurance for a set amount of time
attributes.background:
I and thousands of people across the country have been victims of theft, be it vehicle, home or personal theft. 

A lot of us feel that the justice system is not helping the victim. We fear going through our insurance company as it affects us by increasing our insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details: There are thousands of car, motorcycle and home thefts throughout the year, admittedly not all the culprits are found, but those that are, and are found guilty in our opinion get away lightly, a fine, a suspended sentence. This doesn't really help the victim who could be put out of pocket by losing their no claims bonus on insurance therefore hitting their pockets again. I would like to make it so all criminals found guilty are liable to pay the victims insurance for a set amount of time.

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in the Lord Chancellor
attributes.background: Liz Truss's response to the attacks in the press on the Law Lords is completely inadequate: she doesn't condemn them for saying the ruling was politically motivated but she does refer to the government's intention to appeal to the Supreme Court. She should speak for the judiciary, not the government

attributes.action: child sex offenders not be allowed to apply for contact with their own children
attributes.background: After so many families having to deal with their child being sexually abused, I think that no family should have the added pressures and stress of the abusers applying for contact with any child they have parental responsibility for until investigations completed and sentences have been spent.
attributes.additional_details: 80% of child sexual abuse victims under 16 are abused by a family friend, family member or a person known to the family. These child sex offenders have a "right" to apply for contact with children they have parental responsibility for. This is wrong and change MUST happen now!!

attributes.action: Include sexual orientation and gender identity in sexual education.
attributes.background: Sexual education often only talks about heterosexual sex and relationships, which often leaves LGBT people feel left out as they cannot relate to the things they're being taught. By including information about sexual/gender identity, this would help people to understand them and not bully them.
attributes.additional_details: According to Keelly Abbott, “Lesbian, gay and bisexual students could be left vulnerable here with a lack of any sex education that is relevant to them.”, which is often the case. Without the attention to homosexual relationships and gender identity, homophobia and transphobia is prevalent in schools. 50% of trans people, in a study provided by Huffington post, said that they'd experienced transphobic bullying, and 69.1% of LGBT members experiencing homophobia and biphobia.

attributes.action: Replace 5p plastic bags for PAPER BAGS.
attributes.background:
We, students at the School of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Kingston University, would like to see the offer of plastic bags by supermarkets and shopping outlets replaced by PAPER bags instead.
Paper bags can be very sturdy and are eco-friendly. 
Please, join us in our campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
We are also having a competition of art work based on Paper Bags, which will be exhibited at Stanley Picker Gallery (London).
More details about will be available at our Twitter account: @PaperBagsKU

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Ban slug pellet production that are not animal friendly
attributes.background:
My poor little dog passed away yesterday because of the cruel acts of someone leaving slug pellets disguised for an animal to eat.
People do not realise the consequences of how poisonous they are and I'm pleading for you all to sign to attempt to ban all non animal friendly pellets from production.

attributes.action: Delay the decision to build HS2 until Post Brexit
attributes.background: The UKs  future spending needs to ensure that any government spending supports the UK post Brexit economy.HS2 doesn't benefit the whole of the U.K. The decision to build a second rail system providing marginally faster journey times in to London  needs to be delayed.
attributes.additional_details: Post Brexit future offers  both potential problems & benefits  to the Uk and the government need to delay any decision regarding HS2 until post Brexit and the spending priorities are clearer.A commitment to billions of pounds of spending months before Article 50 is issued on a project criticised by  professionals and public alike  .The decision needs to be delayed .HS2 project even If completed within budget will leave little budget for post Brexit investment in UK business & UK communities.

attributes.action: Advise the Queen to make London Borough of Richmond a Royal Borough
attributes.background: Richmond has two existing Royal Palaces (Hampton Court & Kew Palace) and a rich history of Royal connections, patronage and places. No borough deserves Royal status more than Richmond.
attributes.additional_details: I wrote to the Secretary of State a few years ago asking for Royal Borough status for Richmond and it was politely declined in favour of Greenwich. Time to ask again via this petition.

attributes.action: Make the Sure Start Maternity Grant Equal to ALL babies!
attributes.background: When having a baby, you're entitled to apply for a Sure Start Maternity Grant.  However if you/partner dont receive benefits you are immediately singled out and unable to claim, therefore stating just because you earn a living you baby does not have the right to an equal £500.00 kick start to life!

attributes.action: Impose economic sanctions on the USA if they renege on the Paris Climate deal
attributes.background: Climate change is an immediate threat to global ecosystems, livelihoods and communities. The Paris climate agreement is international law and must be fulfilled in order to mitigate dangerous warming. We call for economic sanctions on the USA if they withdraw from the agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
Climate change will rapidly escalate within decades unless urgent action is taken. The USA contribute 16% of global CO2 emissions and must play a leading role in fulfilling the Paris agreement. If the USA withdraw this could lead to catastrophic consequences, with the poorest people in the world suffering the most. If they withdraw, the UK should impose economic sanctions on the USA and encourage its allies to do likewise. 
www.newscientist.com/article/2112164-president-trump-means-we-cant-escape-a-dangerously-warmer-world/ www.scientificamerican.com/article/trump-picks-top-climate-skeptic-to-lead-epa-transition 
www.independent.co.uk/news/science/climate-change-game-over-global-warming-climate-sensitivity-seven-degrees-a7407881.html

attributes.action: Create and support a Women in Engineering Charter
attributes.background: Theresa May recently celebrated the Women in Finance Charter to tackle gender inequality. The lack of STEM capability in the UK is becoming a crisis, we need to take action to ensure there are opportunities for all. We need a diverse industry to provide infrastructure and services for a diverse UK!
attributes.additional_details:
This is the Women in Finance Charter: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/women-in-finance-charter

Lets replicate this for the engineering, including technology, sector.

attributes.action: Separate areas in hospitals for parents suffering a miscarriage or stillbirth
attributes.background: When a woman loses a baby or babies due to either a miscarriage or stillbirth they are placed on a maternity ward to recover. The woman who is grieving is surrounded by women who have just given birth and can hear babies crying. This is very hurtful and noway to help the healing process.
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of this and it is heartbreaking being left on a ward with babies crying when you are trying to come to terms with the fact you have just lost your baby. During my experience a midwife had come in the room and congratulated me only to be told that my baby hadn't survived. I believe a separate area would benefit parents and help with the healing process. An area where information could be talked about and not whispered and where midwives could not make a hurtful mistake

attributes.action: Stop aid to countries that have a nuclear/space program put monies saved in NHS
attributes.background: Billions are sent abroad to foreign countries that have nuclear or space programs or both. And our own NHS doesnt have enough funds to survive. Pakistan received over £300.000.0000 from the UK whilst spending millions on their space and nuclear ambitions. Let's readjust and help our NHS .
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-34176846
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-12607537
http://news.sky.com/story/ae-departments-fail-to-hit-waiting-times-for-16-months-nhs-figures-show-10725757

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax.  It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
attributes.background:
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax

attributes.action: STOP THE BAN ON MENTHOL CIGARETTES
attributes.background:
Menthol cigarettes are about to become illegal.

Under new tobacco laws, menthol flavour in cigarettes will be phased out over the next four years – ready for a complete ban on May 20, 2020.
attributes.additional_details: As a smoker trying to cut down I've found menthol cigarettes to be a stepping stone to cut down to around 5 cigarettes a day from around 30. With the withdrawal of menthol cigarettes people will turn to illegal ways to get hold of them. Crime and costs for the government will rocket. Also people won't have an effective way to stop so problems will get worse. Also cigarettes will be no longer sold in packs of ten so this will encourage harsher smoking and will cost more on the NHS. STOP THE BAN

attributes.action: Approve an Independence Referendum if the Scottish Parliament votes to call one.
attributes.background: The Scottish Government was elected on a promise to hold a second Independence Referendum should Scotland be taken out of the EU against the will of its people. As a result of the Brexit Vote, Westminster must not impede the Scottish Parliament if it votes to call a second Independence Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Both Theresa May and Sir Michael Fallon have stated that there is no need for a second Independence Referendum during the current parliament, which runs to 2020. 

It must be the Scottish Parliament, as the elected representatives of the Scottish people, who make decisions on Scotland's future. 

The Scottish Parliament must have the freedom to call a second Independence Referendum, and decide Scotland's future relationship with the EU, and the rest of the world.

attributes.action: Government to make Child abuse a forefront issue & change laws for offenders!
attributes.background: I believe Child abuse especially sexual is not talked about enough when it is happening way too often. The goverment & the nation need to step up & work together to clamp down on catching & ending this inhumane crime. I would like it to be a forefront issue of the government & police & laws changed.
attributes.additional_details: Whether this is done by extra funding, volunteering or campaining. It is a responsibility of every normal human being especially parents who knows this is wrong. I would also like to see laws changed for sexual offenders to receive the death penalty as there is no place for their kind in this world & any child abusers to be sterilised from having anymore. This is not the type of world I want my children to live in & I believe it is all our duty for anyone who agrees with me.
